intro: Atraphaxis kopetdagensis, commonly known as the Kopetdag Atraphaxis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is well adapted to dry environments, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
